definition: to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation

sentences.english: Just then a car came up and she was knocked down onto the ground.
sentences.chinese: 這是一輛車開過去，把她碰倒在地。

sentences.english: He was burnt by knocking over the boiling kettle.
sentences.chinese: 他碰倒了開水壺，燙傷了。

sentences.english: He knocked over the jug by accident .
She has knocked a cup over again.
Unluckily on the road you smashed a little boy.
sentences.chinese: 不小心在路上碰倒了一個小孩。

sentences.english: An oil heater is knock over and burst instantly into flames.
sentences.chinese: 油加熱器碰倒了，頓時燃起了一片大火。

sentences.english: Isabel rose so abruptly that she knocked down her chair.
sentences.chinese: 伊莎貝爾起得太急了，以致碰倒了她坐的椅子。

definition: to overturn/to overthrow/to strike down (an enemy)
to fall and smash into pieces
to knock down/to knock over/to run over (sb)
to fall down/to slip and fall/to throw sb to the ground
to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
to stagger/to stumble/to reel/Taiwan pr. [lie4 ju1]
